definition: certificate/proof/to prove/to demonstrate/to confirm/variant of 症[zheng4]

sentences.english: The first section is conspectus of criminal written deposition.
sentences.chinese: 第一章爲刑事書面證言概論。

sentences.english: It will also criticise ministers for refusing to give evidence.
sentences.chinese: 它也將對部長們拒絕給予證言提出批評。

sentences.english: The chief method is to take depositions of parties and witnesses.
sentences.chinese: 主要的方法是錄取當事人和證人的宣誓證言。

sentences.english: The lawyer confuted the testimony of the witness by showing actual photographs of the accident.
sentences.chinese: 律師出示那次事故的真實照片，駁倒了證人的證言。

sentences.english: The eloquent lawyer impugned the witness's story in the court.
sentences.chinese: 這位雄辯的律師在法庭上對證人的證言提出質疑。

sentences.english: The records of what was said by the witnesses are called the depositions.
sentences.chinese: 證人證言的記錄就稱爲書面證詞。

sentences.english: What makes expert witnesses credible with jurors?
sentences.chinese: 什麼使專家證言讓陪審員感到可靠？

sentences.english: The accomplice providing testimony in criminal litigation has special role.
sentences.chinese: 在刑事訴訟活動中，提供證言的同案犯具有特殊地位。

sentences.english: The Testimonial should be unlimited characters and either Text or HTML.
sentences.chinese: 證言應是無限的字符和文本或HTML格式。

sentences.english: The silent bear no witness against themselves.
sentences.chinese: 沉默者不會作出不利於自己的證言。

definition: loss (of sth through natural disaster, theft etc) (law)
forged book/book of dubious authenticity/misattributed book/Apocrypha
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
(idiom) to talk in a roundabout way to cover up the truth/evasive
